entry.title: Dear Mr. Uther Pendragon
entry.summary:
Author: gloriask

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,918Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 135

Summary: After a heated argument with his son three years ago, Arthur left home, and Uther hadn’t spoken a single word to him since.That is, until he started receiving some rather peculiar emails.Hunith was enjoying her movie night when, just as Colin Firth was proposing in his delightfully broken Portuguese, another proposal was unfolding on her porch.Merlin was no Elizabeth, and Arthur was certainly no Mr. Darcy. Now has Hunith's pov.

entry.title: Voted Most Likely To Run Away With You
entry.summary:
Author: sherrwin

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,708Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 24

Summary: To save the Prince, Merlin's magic is revealed and King Uther sentences him to death, to be burned on the stake. However Prince Arthur has a different plan, where he decides to run away with Merlin, forsaking his rights to the throne and to serve a self-voluntary exile beside Merlin.This journey covers riches to rags, roads of difficulties and staying incognito from both foes and allies yet under the worst circumstances the duo finds themselves nurturing a bond stronger than friends whilst learning to embrace their flaws to adapt and overcome hurdles together.Slight Inspiration: From the scene where Arthur tells Gwen (his literal queen) that if he wasn't the King, he would become a farmer and bring Merlin with him.

entry.title: Wooden Dragons
entry.summary:
Author: CaffeinatedFlumadiddle

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,965Chapters: 12/20Kudos: 1,016

Summary: “You-” Ygraine said, stepping up to point a finger in Uther’s face. “You are a liar and a murderer. The fact you think someone as sweet and caring as Vivienne is destined to marry you is a tragedy in itself, but if you expect me to hand over my brother’s rightful claim to Camelot’s throne-”“My claim to Camelot’s throne,” Uther threw back, face growing more red as Arthur looked between his parents in utter bewilderment. Merlin didn’t blame him. He had envisioned Uther and Ygraine’s love story to be more… well, less based in war and battles.Ygraine’s eyes narrowed as she grabbed a goblet of wine and threw it in Uther’s face. A few of the guards shifted, but Uther only raised a hand to pause them, spitting out the wine with furious eyes.“You,” Ygraine said coldly. “Are unworthy to sit upon a stool, let alone a throne.”From a few feet away, Balinor scoffed as he sipped from his own goblet. “I kind of like having her as a hostage, Uther. She livens up the place.”OrIn a desperate attempt to save Arthur at Camlann, Merlin tries to reverse time. It works perhaps a tad too well.

entry.title: A Friend Indeed
entry.summary:
Author: takemetorivendell

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,297Chapters: 6/7Kudos: 28

Summary: Merlin has always protected his clotpole of a king, long before he ever became a king, but who has protected Merlin? The knights would argue they do. The servants and kitchen staff would argue just as hard that they were the ones looking after the scrawny manservant, thank you very much. But Lily, Merlin’s long-time friend, would reason she gets the honor of Merlin’s protector. After all, who is better able to protect a magic-user than a fellow magic-user?(Arthur, of course, would be completely bewildered by all of this.)But while Camelot is destined for peace and happiness, there is rather a lot of darkness and tragedy fated to happen first.

entry.title: I Was Born From and With It
entry.summary:
Author: Jpg_26862

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,826Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 16

Summary: He had touched magic. He whipped around, his eyes feeling like they were popping out of his skull as he gaped at Arthur. He curled his magic around Arthur, searching, seeking out the sparks he had felt moments before. And there it was. Pulsing through his veins, heightening with his enjoyment of his hunt, quickening his reaction times, making him move faster, pushing him forward. Merlin couldn’t speak a single word, even as Arthur shoved him up against a wall and ordered some of the knights around him to throw him in the dungeons. The Crown Prince of Camelot had magic, and he didn’t even know it.With Merlin's arrival in Camelot, secrets long buried are revealed from every corner, and magic runs deep.

entry.title: Heart of Albion
entry.summary:
Author: Lightnessmoon

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,629Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 105

Summary: She thought he had got married. She thought Camelot had not changed.Merlyn returns to Camelot after learning healing magic from the druids. Camelot looks and feels the same. Worse so does a certain King.A King she has been best friends with for years. A King she believed got married. It was this news that broke her heart. She needed time to heal herself.She is not aware until she returns Arthur did not marry Gwen.Arthur hasn't changed in her time away. He is still completely overprotective of her.Merlyn is completely oblivious. She thought time away would heal her heart. Being back in Camelot rekindles her feelings. She and Arthur could never possibly be.For one she is the very thing she could get killed for: magic.But not all is as it seems. Magic is not outlawed. The biggest thing of all is that Merlyn has no idea that she is the one Arthur is engaged to.

entry.title: Of what once was theirs
entry.summary:
Author: Theoneyoudreamofinthenight

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,685Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 37

Summary: One morning, Merlin wakes to silence. The ley-lines are still. The druids are powerless. Creatures of the Old Religion begin to wither and die. Magic, once the heartbeat of Albion, is gone.All of it, except for him. And as Camelot descends into confusion and fear, Merlin remains untouched. But that is the problem. Because Merlin was never just a sorcerer. He was never just a servant. He is the source. The cradle. The god who forgot he was divine.Now the magic starves, and it feeds through him. As Gaius pleads for secrecy and Arthur demands answers, Merlin is left with an impossible choice: reveal the truth to the prince he loves—or let the world rot in silence.And the longer he waits, the hungrier the magic becomes. The lonelier he becomes.

entry.title: Unbreakable Chains
entry.summary:
Author: Ireadtoomanybooks

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,230Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 93

Summary: Merlin never wanted to come to Camelot. But with his home reduced to ashes and nowhere else to turn, he has no choice but to seek refuge with his uncle, a court physician under King Uther’s rule. All he wants is a quiet life—one of healing, learning, and keeping his strange gifts hidden.But the moment he steps within Camelot’s walls, he feels it. A presence watching. A hunger waiting.Prince Arthur Pendragon is nothing like the noble protector of legends. He is ruthless, possessive, and drawn to Merlin in ways neither of them fully understand. Every time Merlin tries to escape, Arthur is there to catch him—tender, terrifying, and utterly unwilling to let him go.

entry.title: A Legend that Begins With a Crush
entry.summary:
Author: Clearwater96

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,178,633Chapters: 76/?Kudos: 1,162

Summary: Arthur Pendragon and Merlin were literally from two different worlds. One is a prince from a great kingdom and the other a common farm boy from the next kingdom over. These two should have never met.But that was before they realized their parents were once friends and arranged the two of them to marry when they reached adulthood. That was before Uther turned on magic and Hunith went on the run with her infant son.Now, twenty years have passed and the Prince, Arthur Pendragon is far out of his depth. After four months of marriage and learning what he has about Merlin, he knows that things need to change, but doesn’t know what can be done.And with every attempt at trying going wrong, with mysterious boys showing up wanting to be a knight, strange physician’s trying to coerce his consort away, even stranger ladies who’ve seen to weaken Arthur’s brain, and the arrival of an odd Druid boy they need to risk it all just to get to safety…will Arthur ever get things to go right?

entry.title: The Sorcerer Who Was Her
entry.summary:
Author: SChryslerS

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 100,863Chapters: 37/?Kudos: 573

Summary: The great and wise sorcerer, the closest confidant and most trusted ally of King Arthur, was born a girl. This single truth changes nothing—his wisdom remains boundless, his power undiminished, his destiny unshaken. And yet, it changes everything, for within this paradox lies a secret, a force beyond mere magic, one that reshapes not only his own fate but the fate of the world itself.
